Posts.Content: Hi there, 'm 47 and started my chemo om May 11th, FEC for 3 sessions then FEC-T for last 3, with surgery to follow, then 3 weeks of radio. Please believe me when I say its not as bad as you could imagine, any side effects you may have are catered for with all sorts of meds to counter act them, the first 3 days when  I was  on steroids and anti sickness I felt absolutely fine, just keep on top of them, the come down off the steroids made me feel a bit weary and teary for just a couple of days then by day 7 I was visiting friends in London having a merry old time, I had my second session less than 48 hours ago and I've just come back from a weekend in Liverpool. I too am trying the Paxman cooling system, again after reading reports of how uncomfortable it was I find it perfectly doable, yes the first 5-10 mins are a bit uncomfortable and bit like brain freeze from an ice cream but then it all goes numb and apart from the chin strap to hold it in place I forget its there. Make sure you drink plenty of fluids before your appointment to get the veins nice and plump and keep your hands warm to open the veins  up as you have the cap on half an hour before the treatment starts, the duration of the treatment , then one and half hours after, I have found my hair is thinning a little but not as anyone else can tell, I too have a wig consultation on the cards just in case. My worst side effect is the hot flushes, which keeps most of the family highly amused, when I start rushing about to get outside. You'll find your own way of coping and please believe me when I say I am the biggest stress head in the world, but this is not half as bad as I expected. try and stay positive and listen to your body. Good luck Love and hugs Jojo x
Posts.Title: June 2017 Chemotherapy

Posts.Content: Rant Warning !  Finished my FEC and had first T last Friday  Had excruciating whole body pain for last 2 days even lying in bed is agony, so gave in and rang Acute Oncology line to see if they could prescribe me any stronger painkillers, I generally have a high pain threshold but this is something else.  Nurses response ...  well it is to be expected so if the paracetamol isnt working go to your local pharmacy and ask the strongest they can give you Me ..  can't you prescribe something.  Nurse ..  well if you ring back later this afternoon I'll let you know !   Might just pop to a&e prob more help !
Posts.Title: Useless !

Posts.Content: Hi just to let you know there is light, one week on and I have managed to travel by 2 trains into London with hubby to meet friends from Norway, currently sitting in the Nags Head in Covent Garden with a lovely ice cold lager, yeah my legs feel like they belong to the scarecrow from Wizard of Oz but I'm here !!!! We CAN and WILL do this  Lots of love  Xxxx
Posts.Title: Due to start chemo 24th May

Posts.Content: Hi  I started FEC-T last Wednesday, (10th), apart from feeling really tired and washed out, it's not too bad, although I have had to concede to the fact I cannot go on as normal, which is ultimately what I had intended. Only 5  days later I am literally taking each hour as it comes, I tried to work on Saturday but only lasted 4 hours, it was far too much, luckily I have an amazing employer who supports me 110%, take all your meds and listen to your body is the best advice I can give.  Good luck to you x
Posts.Title: Due to start chemo 24th May

Posts.Content: Hi not at all.  I had my op Oct 16th 2018, spent one night in hospital sent home with one drain which was taken out 4 days later, healed really well all dissolvable stitched and glue, it’s very important to do your excercises if you’re going to have radio after, I did mine religiouslly And don’t have any mobility problems at all. Please don’t hesitate to get in touch if you have any further questions  take care  x
Posts.Title: Licap Flap Tomorrow

Posts.Content: Hi Poppyflower,  Alls good !  The surgeons wanted me out of the hospital the same day but  the anaesthetist had put me on a morphine pump, it wasn’t half as painful as I expected and healed really well very quickly, and only had drains in for 4 days  the only downside was fluid I had to have drained a couple of times but as the area is numb for a long time after ( even now ) even that wasn’t a problem. I do still however have some small pockets of fluid and there is still some swelling which I am quite conscious of.  On the whole everything went really well  If you need anymore info just shout  xxx
Posts.Title: Licap Flap Tomorrow

Posts.Content: Hey Poppyflower,  All went well really, docs wanted me out same day but the aneasthtist has put me on a morphine pump so got sent home next morning, only 1 drain which was in 3 days, I did have to go back a couple of times to have some fluid taken off but as the whole area is numb after surgery it’s not painful at all, everything healed really well although i do still have  lots of small pockets of fluid which just have  to disperse on their own accord and there is still some significant swelling which hopefully when I see surgeons again next month they might suggest something as I am quite self conscious about it.  So all in all nothing to complain about really. hope all goes well for you and if you need anymore info just ask  Jo  xxx
Posts.Title: Licap Flap Tomorrow

Posts.Content: Hi all haven’t been on here for ages, had last T on 1st Sept and finally feeling relatively normal, although the constant eye twitching is driving me bonkers!  I’m in tomorrow for my lumpectomy for the two tumours which are quite far apart so having a Licap flap, and all lymph nodes removed,  The hospital staff have all been amazing and I have a really good relationship with my surgeons  but today i’m Getting the colly wobbles, not the actual procedure but the outcome, I made the mistake of looking at images  online ( broke my own rules) and wish I hadn’t.  My husband I have to say hasn’t been the most supportive in a practical sense one of his first questions at my pre op was to ask how long before I could drive, so I could carry on helping with his business, my friends have drifted, one actually told me I had to stop with the dramatics when I was really ill after first T as it wasn’t just about me and my illness, needless to say we don’t speak very often now but I suppose it’s the nature of the beast.  Has anyone else had a Licap and how did you get on with it.  Lots of love  Jojo X
Posts.Title: Licap Flap Tomorrow

Posts.Content: Hi lovely, I'm on a different regime, just had 2nd  FEC-T, I found whilst I was on the initial  3 day steroids I was absolutely fine,  days 4-7 were particularly rough, especially Day 4. but gradually during day 7 I could feel the 'normal' me returning, today is day 9 and I've been out all day with my son. Make notes of how you feel, symptoms etc, to take to you oncology appointments, there may be something they can do to help you, as everyone reacts differently and even the experts can't predict how your body will react before you get your first chemo. I find sitting outside in the fresh air with a good book (I treated myself to a new Kindle) even if you have to wrap up, helps a great deal. And talk about how you are feeling, don't bottle it up! Scream if you have to but get it out. I have found great comfort from  the kind ladies on here who have taken their time to advise me, so keep talking and asking, you'll get there, I promise. Sending you a massive hug and remember tomorrow is another day closer to beating this. lots of love Jo x I have found great comfort from all of the kind ladies on here who have given me their own pearls of wisdom.
Posts.Title: Post Chemo - when will I start feeling better?

Posts.Content: Thank you everyone, I just want to hide away here and not return to real life, the majority of the time I'm ok I just have a wobble every now and then, I really appreciate all of your kind words.  Xxx
Posts.Title: Start FEC-T May 10th

Posts.Content: Hi all On holiday at mo in beautiful Croatia, get back next Saturday in time to prepare for first session, think it's finally dawned on me what's going to happen.  Hope all had a good bank holiday  Jo  X
Posts.Title: Start FEC-T May 10th

Posts.Content: I'm going on Wednesday for my first Chemo appointment, could you please tell me what to expect, I was only diagnosed on Thursday so at the moment I still feel like Alice dropping down through the rabbit hole, the last few days have all been a bit of a blur and somehow doesn't seem real X
Posts.Title: * * * APRIL Breast cancer chemo club ****

Posts.Content: Hi Thank you for that, yes it's my very first appointment to assess me, luckily the hospital is only a couple of miles away. I have decided I'm going to give the cold cap a go, I was a hairdresser for 20 years and although my mantra has always been it's only hair it will grow back, I'm dreading the prospect of losing mine completely, I am going to have it cut quite short on Friday, so hopefully if it does thin etc, under a cap it won't be so noticeable, I fully intend carrying on day to day as normal as possible, work have been amazing and are supporting me 110%, I realise everyone responds to chemo differently and only time will tell how I'm going to feel on any given day, but I have read so many posts on this site  and the breast cancer U.K. Site where people have said how much easier it was than they expected which is keeping me quite positive, thank you again.  Have a lovely Sunday x
Posts.Title: * * * APRIL Breast cancer chemo club ****

Posts.Content: Hi all,  I had my licap surgery a year ago tomorrow, had a few niggles but nothing major, on Saturday I was in an incident whereby some random idiot decided to ram my car whilst I was driving my granddaughter to a birthday party, obviously my main concern was for her, the police and paramedics came to check her out and she was deemed fine at the scene, I had no injuries was just shaken up and really  angry that someone could put her a risk, anyways since then aches and pains have materialised across my shoulder and surgery site where the seat belt cut across me, I already have lymphedema in my arm, breast and around where tissue was taken from my back, I haven't been to the hospital yet and I will ring the breast clinic today when they open, , has anyone else had any accidents post surgery of a similar nature, I don't want to make a fuss but i'm, concerned the lymphedema may deteriorate.  And of course the driver is untraceable as the car was on false plates!
Posts.Title: Accident
